availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Waller Head (Sumner County, Tennessee, attorney and politician)

body.p: Sumner County, Tennessee, attorney and politician. Tennessee native. Married to Evelyn Brooks Head. Father of Henryetta Head, Charles R. Head, Laclins Head, Fannie Head, John W. Head Jr., and Robert A. Head. Attorney in Sumner County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Sumner County in 1850. Member of Tennessee State Senate from 1855 to 1857. Reporter for Tennessee State Supreme Court from 1858 to 1862. Attorney General for state of Tennessee from 1859 to 1862. Attorney in Sumner County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Sumner County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Sumner County, District 5, p. 168A.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Tennessee, Sumner County, District No. 5, p. 10 of 12 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com)

Library of Congress: Chronicling America, https://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn85026955/1874-11-17/ed-1/seq-1/ (accessed January 16, 2020).
